Options: A) Use more technical jargon to sound more professional.
B) Show the results and impact of your contributions.

Options: A) One sentence or less.
B) Approximately two to five sentences or three to six lines.
C) At least 10 lines to show a comprehensive overview.
D) There is no recommended length.

D) Only use generic phrases like "highly motivated individual."

C) "Innovative content creator."
D) "I have created innovative content."

MCQs.Question: What is the final common mistake discussed in the video?

B) Using too many specific, quantifiable metrics.

D) Writing a summary that is too long.

B) It can replace the need for a cover letter.
C) It helps you avoid using "fluffy" content and cliches.
D) It can grab a recruiter's attention and showcase your value right away.

Title: Write an Amazing Cover Letter: 3 Golden Rules

Options: A) Using a professional font and layout.
B) Mentioning a connection with the company to hook the reader.
